sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 8 vocabulary words:

add → ?          remove → ?
part → ?         structure → ?
system → ?       differ → ?
similar → ?      same → ?

(Answers: jmina, vimcu, pagbu, stura, ciste, frica, simsa, mintu)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

Connective Types

Type Cmavo Connects
Sumti .e, .a, .o, .u Arguments
Selbri je, ja, jo, ju Predicates (shared places)
Bridi-tail gi'e, gi'a, gi'o, gi'u Predicates (different places)
Forethought ge...gi, ga...gi Either type

Meanings

Vowel Meaning
e and (both)
a or (at least one)
o iff (same truth)
u whether or not

Week 21 Vocabulary

Lojban English Lojban English
jmina add vimcu remove
pagbu part stura structure
ciste system frica differ
simsa similar mintu same

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate:

  1. jmina →
  2. pagbu →
  3. ciste →
  4. simsa →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. remove →
  2. structure →
  3. differ →
  4. same →
Answers
  1. add
  2. part
  3. system
  4. similar
  5. vimcu
  6. stura
  7. frica
  8. mintu

Part B: Connectives (8 points)

Choose the correct connective:

  1. I and you go (both) → mi ___ do cu klama
  2. I or you go (at least one) → mi ___ do cu klama
  3. The dog is big and fast (shared) → lo gerku cu barda ___ sutra
  4. I eat and drink (different objects) → mi citka ___ pinxe

Translate:

  1. Both Alice and Bob go. (forethought)
  2. Neither I nor you go.
  3. I but not you understand.
  4. Either I or you talk. (forethought)
Answers
  1. .e
  2. .a
  3. je
  4. gi'e
  5. ge la .alis. gi la .bob. cu klama
  6. mi na.enai do cu klama
  7. mi na.e do cu jimpe
  8. ga mi gi do cu tavla

Part C: Complex Sentences (4 points)

Translate:

  1. I and you are both tall and beautiful.
  2. Alice goes to Paris and works in London.
  3. Either the dog or the cat is big and fast.
  4. The system has parts that are similar.
Answers
  1. mi .e do cu clani je melbi
  2. la .alis. cu klama la .paris. gi'e gunka bu'u la .london.
  3. ga lo gerku gi lo mlatu cu barda je sutra
  4. lo ciste cu se pagbu lo simsa

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Build connected sentences:

Use at least:

  • One .e or je
  • One gi'e
  • One forethought (ge...gi or ga...gi)
  • Two vocabulary words

Example:

mi .e do cu jmina lo pagbu
.i ge la .alis. gi la .bob. cu gunka gi'e surla
.i lo ciste cu simsa je barda
.i mi na.e do cu frica

(I and you add a part. Both Alice and Bob work and rest. The systems are similar and big. I but not you differ.)

Create your own and say it aloud.

Week 21 Complete Reference

Vocabulary (8):

Lojban English Lojban English
jmina add vimcu remove
pagbu part stura structure
ciste system frica differ
simsa similar mintu same

Grammar:

Type And Or Examples
Sumti .e .a mi .e do
Selbri je ja barda je melbi
Bridi-tail gi'e gi'a klama gi'e cadzu
Forethought ge...gi ga...gi ge mi gi do

Cumulative vocabulary: ~172 words

Summary

You completed Week 21 on logical connectives. You can now connect sumti, selbri, and bridi-tails with and, or, iff, and whether-or-not.

Next week preview: Week 22 introduces sumtcita (modal tags) — ri'a, mu'i, bu'u, pi'o, bau.
